intro: Lotononis micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, and it is often found in open, sunny areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
